asset.author: KitchenAid
asset.hookText: “Secrets of Louisville Chefs” Host Tim Laird uses the KitchenAid precise heat mixing bowl to make fondue, which can be done as a stand mixer attachment or as a standalone slow cooker. For more information about KitchenAid stand mixer attachments, please visit: http://www.kitchenaid.com/countertop-appliances/stand-mixer-attachments/.

transcripts: The butler in the shops corner with kitchen aid this time I'm making fondue and kitchen aides precise mixing bowl makes it easy. You can use it as a stand alone slow cooker or get double duty out of it by using it as an attachment with your stand mixer and it takes out all the gas even the trickiest of ingredients to make a dessert. It starts with butter. Sugar heavy cream and bourbon with a Platter of pound cake or strawberries. And if you have a kitchen aid you can do the same thing and keep everything moving. Our accessory makes dishes like go easy without all the work. In the chef's corner with kitchen aid.
